<!-- metadata:{"confidence":8,"steps":[{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"isDashboardEnabled\" -n packages/frontend/editor-ui/src/features/insights/components/tables/InsightsTableWorkflows.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"class=\\\"ellipsis\\\"\" -n packages/frontend/editor-ui/src/features/insights/components/tables/InsightsTableWorkflows.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -r \"export type TableHeader\" $(npm root || echo node_modules)/@n8n* -n"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]}]} -->
The style block was switched to CSS-modules but several template elements (e.g. the router-link in the workflowName column) still use static class names (class="link", class="ellipsis"). These classes will no longer match the generated module hashes, so styles will silently break.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
<!-- metadata:{"confidence":10,"steps":[]} -->
The value 'right' is not a valid value for justify-content in CSS Flexbox. The correct value is 'flex-end'.

```suggestion
	justify-content: flex-end;
```

<!-- metadata:{"confidence":6,"steps":[{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"new Function('event'\" -R"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"sed -n '1,260p' packages/frontend/@n8n/chat/src/components/RichMessageRenderer.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"with (sandbox\" -R packages/frontend/@n8n/chat/src/components/RichMessageRenderer.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n -A5 -B5 \"new Function(\" packages/frontend/@n8n/chat/src/components/RichMessageRenderer.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"const scriptContainer\" -n packages/frontend/@n8n/chat/src/components/RichMessageRenderer.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"dangerousProps\" -R"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]}]} -->
Adding the non-standard `scoped` attribute to a runtime-injected `<style>` tag has no effect in browsers; styles will leak globally, contrary to the intended encapsulation.
Import statement is commented out using inline comments rather than properly removing or uncommenting the line. This creates confusing code.

discussion_comments.comment_body:
<!-- metadata:{"confidence":9,"steps":[{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -n \"watch(\" -n packages/frontend/editor-ui/src/components/canvas/elements/nodes/render-types/parts/CanvasNodeStatusIcons.vue"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]},{"text":"","toolCalls":[{"args":{"command":"grep -R \"isNodeExecuting\" -n"},"toolName":"executeCommand"}]}]} -->
`watch` is imported but never used in this file, which may trigger the linter/TypeScript compiler’s unused-variable rule and adds unnecessary bytes to the bundle.

```suggestion
import { computed } from 'vue';
```
